As an AI language model, I don't have personal beliefs or opinions, but I would say that it could have added more depth to the characters and their struggles if Chronicle had directly addressed the challenges faced by individuals who don't fit traditional racial categories. While the movie does a good job of portraying the characters as individuals and not solely as representations of their race, it does not explore the ways in which race and ethnicity impact their experiences and how they are perceived by society.

By addressing these issues more directly, the movie could have helped to shed light on the complex and often challenging experiences of those who do not fit neatly into traditional racial categories. It could have also served as a platform for discussions about race and identity, which are particularly relevant in today's social and political climate.

However, it's important to note that the movie's focus on the individual struggles of the characters, such as Andrew's abusive upbringing and Matt's pressure to live up to his father's expectations, is still valuable and relatable to many viewers. The lack of direct commentary on race in Chronicle may also reflect the fact that people who don't fit traditional racial categories often face a lack of representation and acknowledgement of their experiences in media and society.
